Posts.Title: Why chemo if no nodes or LV is present? melissa233 MinusTwo

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2017 07:58PM powerthruit wrote: Speaking to the surgery itself and side effects, I had none. It was done laparoscopically. The surgery itself was about 45 min. I went in the morning and was home by 6:30 pm. The first night and next daywere painful. Felt like bad cramps.
Posts.Title: Possible hysterectomy—opinions Carrie37 Carrie37

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2015 02:29PM powerthruit wrote: I had a little bit of that on round 1 and 2. Here are couple of thoughts. I religiously, do the preemptive strike by keeping my mouth throat clean. Brush after eating, swish and gargle Biotene or you can make your own salt/b-soda version. It seems like you are doing pretty well, and the above might just do the trick. I will say that the Decadron steroid has contributed to a lot of up and down the esophogous, feeling like my sinuses, back of my throat feeling flooded. The second I feel anything going on that front, I pop a couple of Tums. A lot of ladies seem to have these things going on much more severely. I've been doing OK and in my case I projected #3 and 4 to the worst and it's turning out to be #1.
Posts.Title: second week of TC, now lost voice Cantbelievethis powerthruit
